This Risk Management Plan (RMP) covers the PilgrimA?s Pride Mayfield Poultry Processing Facility.  The reason for submitting this RMP is to comply with the mandatory five year resubmission.  This facility has a refrigeration system using anhydrous ammonia as the refrigerant.  The amount of anhydrous ammonia contained in this system meets the US Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) and the US Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) threshold reporting quantity.

Pilgrim's Pride is committed to the safety of its employees and the surrounding community.  Our accidental release prevention policy is designed to comply with the Process Safety Management (PSM) and Risk Management Program (RMP) regulations.  These regulations are designed to prevent the accidental release of ammonia and minimize negative consequences in the event that a release should occur.  Our emergency response policy is designed to comply with all government emergency response regulations.

Pilgrims Pride CorporationA?s accidental release prevention program is based on the following key elements:

A? Hands-on and classroom training of the refrigeration department personnel
A? Preventative maintenance program
A? Operating procedures, written with the participation of the refrigeration department personnel
A? Performance of a process hazard analysis of the entire system including equipment and piping
A? Implementation of an auditing and inspection program
A? Procedure for handling all changes to the system
A? Pre-Startup review procedures for significant system modifications
A? Regular review and update of process safety information
A? Procedures for investigating release incidents or near-misses
A? On site HAZMAT team
A? Emergency Response and Action Plan
A? Hot-work permit program and procedures
A? Line Break procedures
A? Contractor Safety program

The Company follows the International Institute of Ammonia Refrigeration (IIAR) guidelines for safe operations and preventative maintenance o

f the refrigeration equipment.  In addition, the facility has procedures in place for notifying our employees, contractors and their employees of the hazards pertaining to the system, as required under the regulations.  Chemical-specific exposure prevention steps include availability of air purifying respirators for the refrigeration department personnel, and awareness of the hazardous and toxic properties of anhydrous ammonia.  

In accordance with the PSM and RMP regulations, the Company performs periodical audits and hazard reviews to enhance continued safe performance.  Recommended actions to improve safety are identified during these audits and reviews and are tracked regularly for completion as required.  For this RMP submission, a new offsite consequence analysis was performed, including consideration of ammonia release scenarios as A?worst case releaseA? and A?alternative release scenariosA?.
